weather.sunnyTip: On sunny days, monitor soil moisture more frequently as plants may dry out faster. Consider moving sensitive plants away from direct sunlight.
weather.rainyTip: Check drainage on potted plants during rainy periods to prevent root rot. Hold off on watering until soil dries out.
weather.cloudyTip: Cloudy days are perfect for repotting or transplanting as plants experience less stress without direct sunlight.
weather.windyTip: Consider bringing smaller potted plants indoors or providing shelter from strong winds. Check soil moisture as wind can dry plants out.
weather.clearTip: Clear days are great for plant maintenance. Check for pests, prune as needed, and ensure adequate watering.

descriptions.rose: A classic flowering plant known for its beautiful blooms and pleasant fragrance.
descriptions.sunflower: Tall annual plants known for their large, bright yellow blooms that follow the sun.
descriptions.jasmine: Climbing vines or shrubs with intensely fragrant white or yellow flowers.
descriptions.peace-lily: Popular indoor plant with elegant white flowers and glossy leaves.
descriptions.snake-plant: Nearly indestructible plant with tall, stiff leaves. Excellent air purifier.
descriptions.aloe-vera: Succulent plant with medicinal properties. Gel from leaves soothes burns and skin irritations.
descriptions.basil: Aromatic herb used in cooking, especially in Italian and Thai cuisines.
descriptions.lavender: Fragrant perennial herb with purple flowers, known for its calming scent.
descriptions.orchid: Elegant flowering plants with exotic blooms, popular as houseplants.
descriptions.fern: Lush green plants that thrive in humid, shaded environments.

careInstructions.rose: Roses need well-draining soil and regular pruning to encourage blooming. Watch for pests like aphids and blackspot disease.
careInstructions.sunflower: Sunflowers are relatively easy to grow. They need support as they grow taller and regular watering until established.
careInstructions.jasmine: Jasmine likes humid conditions and consistent moisture. Provide a trellis or support for climbing varieties.
careInstructions.peace-lily: Peace lilies prefer humid environments and will droop when thirsty. Keep away from cold drafts and direct sunlight.
careInstructions.snake-plant: Allow soil to dry completely between waterings. Can tolerate low light but grows faster in brighter conditions.
careInstructions.aloe-vera: Plant in well-draining soil and water only when top inch of soil is dry. Watch for brown spots which may indicate too much sun.
careInstructions.basil: Pinch off flower buds to encourage leaf growth. Harvest from the top to promote bushier growth.
careInstructions.lavender: Lavender needs excellent drainage. Prune after flowering to maintain shape and promote new growth.
careInstructions.orchid: Use orchid bark mix for potting. Water weekly by soaking roots, then drain completely. Provide humidity.
careInstructions.fern: Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged. Mist regularly to maintain humidity. Avoid direct sunlight.
